intro: Lastrea venusta, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its broad, velvety leaves that give it its common name. It produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Lastrea venusta is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
